questions.question:
Setting Up kubeadm and cri-dockerd

Task: Prepare the system for Kubernetes by installing cri-dockerd and configuring system parameters. You must set the following sysctl parameters:
- net.ipv6.conf.all.forwarding=1
- net.ipv4.ip_forward=1
- net.netfilter.nf_conntrack_max=131072
- net.bridge.bridge-nf-call-iptables=1

Steps:
1. Install cri-dockerd package from /var/package/cri-dockerd_0.3.9.3-0.ubuntu-jammy_amd64.deb
2. Enable and start cri-docker service
3. Configure the required system parameters listed above
4. Create persistent sysctl configuration in /etc/sysctl.d/k8s.conf
5. Apply sysctl parameters without reboot

Verify that cri-docker service is running and all sysctl parameters are set correctly.

Ingress for echoserver-service

Task: Create an Ingress named echo in namespace echo-sound for service echoserver-service at http://example.org/echo.

Requirements:
- Ingress name: echo
- Namespace: echo-sound
- Host: example.org
- Path: /echo
- Service: echoserver-service
- Port: 8080

Verify the Ingress is working by testing the endpoint.

Installing CNI (Calico)

Task: Install Calico (v3.29.2) as CNI with Network Policy support.

Steps:
1. Create Calico operator from manifest:
   https://raw.githubusercontent.com/projectcalico/calico/v3.29.2/manifests/tigera-operator.yaml
2. Verify operator pods are running:
   kubectl get pods -n tigera-operator
3. Ensure Network Policy support is enabled

Calico is ideal for Network Policies. Ensure pods are running.

Argo CD with Helm

Task: Generate a Helm template for Argo CD (v7.7.3) in namespace argocd without CRDs.

Steps:
1. Add Argo Helm repository:
   https://argoproj.github.io/argo-helm
2. Update Helm repositories
3. Generate template for Argo CD v7.7.3
4. Save template to /argo-helm.yaml
5. Ensure CRDs are not included

Verify the template is generated correctly.

PriorityClass for busybox-logger

Task: Create a PriorityClass named high-priority with a value one less than the highest user-defined priority class, and apply it to busybox-logger.

Steps:
1. Check existing PriorityClasses
2. Create high-priority class with appropriate value
3. Apply PriorityClass to busybox-logger deployment
4. Restart deployment to apply changes

Pod evictions are normal with PriorityClass.

Service and NodePort for front-end

Task: Modify the front-end Deployment in namespace sp-culator to expose port 80/tcp, and create a Service named front-end-svc.

Steps:
1. Edit front-end deployment to add container port 80
2. Create NodePort service named front-end-svc
3. Configure service to target front-end pods
4. Set NodePort to 30080

Ensure the Service selector matches Deployment labels.

verification.description: NodePort service exists with correct configuration

questions.question:
StorageClass (low-latency)

Task: Create a StorageClass named low-latency with provisioner rancher.io/local-path and set it as default.

Requirements:
- Name: low-latency
- Provisioner: rancher.io/local-path
- Set as default StorageClass
- Volume binding mode: WaitForFirstConsumer

Delete any old default StorageClass first.

Sidecar for synergy-deployment

Task: Add a sidecar to synergy-deployment using busybox:stable.

Steps:
1. Edit synergy-deployment
2. Add shared-logs emptyDir volume
3. Add sidecar container with busybox:stable
4. Configure sidecar to tail logs from /var/log/synergy-deployment.log
5. Mount shared-logs volume at /var/log in sidecar

Verify the sidecar is running and can access logs.

cert-manager CRDs

Task: Verify cert-manager and extract subject for Certificate CRD.

Steps:
1. Verify cert-manager pods are running
2. Extract cert-manager CRDs to ~/resources.yaml
3. Extract Certificate CRD subject specification to ~/subject.yaml

Use k explain if CRDs confuse you.

WordPress Resource Requests

Task: Adjust WordPress in relative-fawn for 3 replicas with proper resource allocation.

Steps:
1. Check allocatable resources on node01
2. Calculate 10% for node, 90% for WordPress
3. Distribute resources across 3 replicas
4. Update WordPress deployment with resource requests
5. Update init container with same resource requests

If pods fail to schedule, check node capacity.

MariaDB and PVC

Task: Recreate MariaDB in mariadb namespace with a PVC.

Steps:
1. Create PVC named mariadb with 250Mi storage
2. Edit MariaDB deployment to use PVC
3. Mount PVC at /var/lib/mysql
4. Ensure MariaDB pods are running

Ensure the PV is available before creating the PVC.

Migration from Ingress to Gateway API

Task: Migrate a web app from Ingress web to Gateway API, maintaining HTTPS, using GatewayClass nginx.

Steps:
1. Create Gateway web-gateway with HTTPS listener
2. Create HTTPRoute web-route for web service
3. Configure TLS termination with web-tls secret
4. Test HTTPS endpoint
5. Delete old Ingress web

Maintain HTTPS functionality during migration.

HorizontalPodAutoscaler (HPA) for apache-server

Task: Create an HPA named apache-server in namespace autoscale, targeting 50% CPU, with 1-4 pods and a 30-second downscale stabilization window.

Requirements:
- Target: apache-server deployment
- CPU target: 50% utilization
- Min replicas: 1
- Max replicas: 4
- Downscale stabilization: 30 seconds
- Use autoscaling/v2 API

Verify the Deployment exists before creating HPA.

NGINX ConfigMap for TLSv1.3

Task: Update ConfigMap nginx-config in namespace nginx-static to allow only TLSv1.3 connections.

Steps:
1. Edit nginx-config ConfigMap
2. Update nginx.conf to use only TLSv1.3
3. Remove TLSv1.2 from ssl_protocols
4. Restart nginx-static deployment
5. Test TLSv1.2 failure

Ensure TLSv1.2 connections fail and TLSv1.3 works.

NetworkPolicy Selection

Task: Select the correct NetworkPolicy for backend-api pods to only allow ingress traffic from the frontend namespace.

Requirements:
- Backend pods should only allow ingress from frontend namespace
- Backend pods labeled app=backend-api in namespace backend
- Frontend namespace labeled name=frontend
- Create a NetworkPolicy named backend-allow-frontend

DO NOT use backend-allow-all or backend-deny-all - create a new one.

verification.description: Correct NetworkPolicy exists allowing ingress from frontend namespace

questions.question:
Troubleshooting kube-apiserver and kube-scheduler

Task: Troubleshoot and fix kube-apiserver and kube-scheduler services that are not working.

Scenario:
- kube-apiserver and kube-scheduler services are not running
- etcd, kube-controller-manager, and kubelet are working
- Cluster components need to be restored

Steps:
1. Check service status
2. Check logs for errors
3. Check certificates and configurations
4. Restart services if needed
5. Verify cluster health

Verify that both services are running and the cluster is healthy.

verification.description: kube-apiserver and kube-scheduler services are running and cluster is healthy
